content:
Even though the first argument still might be valid on some
other basis, its defenders at least owe an alternative account of its validity.
Often there will be none.
Refuting an argument by showing that it is just likeanother argument that
is obviously no good is a common device in everyday discussions. Here’s
another example:
Matthew:If I had a higher salary, I could buy more things; so, if every-
one had higher salaries, everyone could buy more things.
Kirsty:That’s  just  like  arguing  that
